New Records: Bobby Witt Jr. became the first player in Royals history with consecutive 30-home run seasons.
Key Match Events: Alec Marsh pitched well but gave up two home runs in the fourth inning.
Yordan Alvarez led off with a home run to right, and Jon Singleton hit a two-run homer to right to give Houston a 3-0 lead.
Bobby Witt Jr. hit his 30th home run of the season.
Yuli Gurriel, in his first game with the Royals, hit an RBI single in the sixth.
Tommy Pham had two hits in his debut after being claimed off waivers.
Post-Match Reflections: Royals manager Matt Quatraro expressed frustration over the series loss, stating, 'We didn’t come out of here with any wins. That’s what we play for is to win every day. That stinks.'
Alec Marsh emphasized the importance of moving on from the series, saying, 'We have big ones coming up, so just get to that next game and focus on tomorrow, leaving this one behind us.'
MJ Melendez commented on the tough stretch and expressed hope for better performance at home.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Royals were swept for just the second time this season and swept in a four-game series for the first time since losing four straight to Boston on June 28-July 1, 2021, at Fenway Park.
Kansas City fell 3 1/2 games behind the Guardians in the AL Central.
The Royals had at least one man on in every inning except the second and ninth and finished 1-for-9 with runners in scoring position.
